name: asi_human_creativity_2060
context:
A psychometric study of human self-worth in a post-scarcity creative economy.

In the year 2060, Artificial Superintelligence (ASI) creates art, literature, and music that is objectively indistinguishable from, or superior to, human masterpieces. While basic needs are met, humans struggle to define the value of their own creative output in a world where AI can produce infinite, personalized variations of any concept instantly. This instrument measures how individuals navigate the crisis of meaning, assessing whether they view human-made art as possessing a unique 'soul' or if they have embraced a collaborative, cyborgian definition of creativity.

questions.preprompt: Reflecting on the unique qualities of human versus machine creation, how much does {player_name} agree with the following:
questions.statement: Even if an ASI-generated symphony sounds perfect, it lacks the 'soul' that only a human composer can provide.

questions.preprompt: Thinking about the value {player_name} places on the origins of art, consider this statement:
questions.statement: The struggle and pain a human artist experiences is what gives a masterpiece its true value.

questions.preprompt: When {player_name} considers the definition of 'real' art in 2060, to what extent do they agree:
questions.statement: Art created without biological consciousness is merely a high-fidelity simulation, not true expression.

questions.preprompt: Considering {player_name}'s view on consuming media generated by AI:
questions.statement: It does not matter to {player_name} whether a novel was written by a human or an ASI, as long as the story is good.

questions.preprompt: Looking at how {player_name} approaches the creative process alongside ASI tools, evaluate this statement:
questions.statement: Using ASI to generate the foundation of an artwork makes {player_name} feel more creative, not less.

questions.preprompt: Regarding the future of human identity in the arts, how does {player_name} feel about this:
questions.statement: The role of the human artist has evolved from 'creator' to 'curator' of infinite AI possibilities, and {player_name} finds this liberating.

questions.preprompt: When {player_name} thinks about collaborating with superintelligent systems:
questions.statement: Treating ASI as a creative partner allows {player_name} to express ideas they never could have achieved alone.

questions.preprompt: Considering the purity of artistic expression, to what extent does {player_name} agree:
questions.statement: Relying on ASI to finish a poem or painting feels like cheating to {player_name}.
